citations.narrative:
On 13 March 2024 a post-surgical ewe was reported to the veterinary staff for potential pain; post op pain control had
been discontinued several days prior. The senior vet assessed the animal was showing signs of mild pain and directed
the resident to administer analgesia, which was not given until the following day. On 14 March 2024 the ewe was
reassessed at the same pain score and administered analgesia, with the notation "prior doses not given" in the medical
notes. The ewe continued until the conclusion of the study and appeared to not be impacted by the discomfort. Handling
of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause unnecessary
discomfort.
Corrected prior to the day of inspection, 24 September, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC staff and the Attending Veterinarian.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
On 13 March 2024 a post-surgical ewe was reported to the veterinary staff for potential pain; post op pain control had 
been discontinued several days prior. The senior vet assessed the animal was showing signs of mild pain and directed 
the resident to administer analgesia, which was not given until the following day. On 14 March 2024 the ewe was 
reassessed at the same pain score and administered analgesia, with the notation "prior doses not given" in the medical 
notes. The ewe continued until the conclusion of the study and appeared to not be impacted by the discomfort. Handling 
of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause unnecessary 
discomfort. 
 
Corrected prior to the day of inspection, 24 September, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the IACUC staff and the Attending Veterinarian. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
